alert.note: Alert for Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:11PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Oldham and northeastern Deaf Smith Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 411 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Vega, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Oldham and northeastern Deaf Smith Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
